message: I don't think mental health is really even the issue. Plenty of people have mental illnesses and are still capable of living normal lives. I believe it's the events that happen in a person's life that pushes them over the edge. It could happen to any person. Lets say someone is going through a child custody crisis and one parent is not letting the other see their child. It could be enough to make the parent being neglected get a gun and kill the other. Or maybe someone is feeling treated unfairly at work. They could snap and kill all the people were they work.

@ : Ferg Ferg has faith in the unseen. So do you. Nobody was there when """"The Big Bang"""" happened. If there had been, it wouldn't be called """"The Big Bang *Theory*, it would be called Big Bang *Fact*. Science is a progression of understanding based on human understanding; and, we all know that human understanding has progressed exponentially. Who's to say that the science that is human understanding won't progress to the point that science proves God without doubt?

Rebuttal question: If this is a democracy, why are we allowing what equates to 0.6 percent of the US population to push policy or law on the majority? Resolution: Create a third single stall/toilet bathroom for families and allow anyone to use it. Thus, keeping any potential perverts that would abuse the law out of my daughters bathroom and giving those who are transgender a 'safe space' to do their business. Problem solved.
